Pressure Cooker Steel-Cut Oats

basics   breakfast   make-ahead   oats   pressure-cook   quick   vegan

Makes 10 servings (for the week)
From The Kitchn (loosely adapted)

I make a big pot of steel-cut oats in our Instant Pot just about every Sunday night and divide it into portions for the week ahead. That way, G and I can both take a healthy breakfast to work every day. Bonus, it comes out to like $0.50 a day for breakfast. ðŸ‘ƒ

Total time 20 min

Reheat time 1:30 in the microwave |

2 cups steel cut oats 6 cups water Â¼ teaspoon salt 1 tablespoon coconut oil Optional toppings: honey, raisins, dried fruit, sliced almonds, etc. (to taste)

To prep

Add the water, oats, and salt to the pot and stir to combine. Close and lock the lid, making sure itâ€™s on sealing not venting (Iâ€™ve made this mistakeâ€¦you only make it once). Set to Manual on high pressure for 4 min.

After cooking

Allow the pressure to release naturally. When the lid is safe to unlock, stir in coconut oil and honey (if using).

At this point, you can also add the toppings, or wait until right before eating, your call. Divide up into individual portions and store in the fridge for up to a week.

Day of

Reheat oats for 1:30 in a microwave or in a pot on the stove. If on the stove, add water or cream to thin the oats.

Made with love and many mistakes by Sharon Brener.
